description: From Middle English martel, from Old French martel (modern French marteau), from Late Latin martellus, from Latin martulus, a variant of marculus (“small hammer”).

entries.meaning: A hammer, especially a war hammer.

verbs.description: martel (third-person singular simple present martels, present participle martelling, simple past and past participle martelled)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To strike a blow with, or as with, a hammer.
